text: Andrew White (21 March 1894 – 3 August 1968) was a New Zealand rugby union player. A flanker, White represented and at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the All Blacks, from 1921 to 1925. He played 34 matches for the All Blacks—three as captain—including four internationals. In all he scored 48 points for the national side. White died in Christchurch on 3 August 1968, and was buried at Waimairi Cemetery. title: Andrew White (rugby union)
